name: Mixer Mono
description: This algorithm is a mono mixer - it mixes mono inputs to a mono output. Up to four aux send busses are available, which can be switched to pre- or post-fade.
gui_description: The display shows a level meter for each channel with a thin line at the top indicating 0dBFS. Clipping is shown as a small rectangle over the 0dBFS line. Chevrons indicate mixer gains, and mute/solo states are marked with 'M' or 'S'. Muted channels appear grayed out.

parameters.name: Duplicate_output
parameters.description: An optional duplicate output. Convenient if you want to drive a stereo bus from a mono mix.

parameters.name: Destination
parameters.description: The output bus for the send.

parameters.name: Output_mode_send
parameters.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector for the send.

input_ports.name: Channel Inputs (1-12)
input_ports.description: Up to twelve mono audio inputs per channel.

input_ports.name: Aux Send Busses
input_ports.description: Up to four aux send busses for routing signals pre/post-fade.

output_ports.name: Mixer Output Bus
output_ports.description: The primary mono output of the mixer.

output_ports.name: Duplicate Output Bus (optional)
output_ports.description: An optional secondary output for stereo routing or duplication.
